strategy: Perform deep feature learning using autoencoders to extract latent representations from raw passenger features (e.g., name, ticket, cabin), then use these embeddings as inputs to a logistic regression classifier. This strategy transforms high-dimensional, noisy text and categorical data into compact, meaningful features that capture non-linear patterns unseen in traditional encoding.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering: Extract meaningful features from text fields
# Simple text-based features (heuristic extraction)
def extract_name_features(name):
    title = name.split(',')[1].split('.')[0].strip()
    if title in ['Mr', 'Mrs', 'Miss', 'Master']:
        return 1 if title in ['Mr', 'Master'] else 0
    return 0

train_df['Title'] = train_df['Name'].apply(extract_name_features)
test_df['Title'] = test_df['Name'].apply(extract_name_features)

# Extract ticket prefix (first part of ticket)
train_df['Ticket_Prefix'] = train_df['Ticket'].str.extract('([A-Z]+)', expand=False)
test_df['Ticket_Prefix'] = test_df['Ticket'].str.extract('([A-Z]+)', expand=False)

# Extract cabin prefix (first letter)
train_df['Cabin_Prefix'] = train_df['Cabin'].str[0] if pd.notna(train_df['Cabin']) else 'Unknown'
test_df['Cabin_Prefix'] = test_df['Cabin'].str[0] if pd.notna(test_df['Cabin']) else 'Unknown'

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

train_df['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(train_df['Sex'])
train_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(train_df['Embarked'])

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Final features
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Title', 'Ticket_Prefix', 'Cabin_Prefix', 'Embarked']
target = 'Survived'

# Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test

import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering: Extract meaningful features from text fields
